gameContent

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • designPatterns.Subject
      • gameContent.Game

  • public class Game
extends Subject
    Represents the top-level element of a Monopoly game's state. In order to use this model with the MVC-pattern, it extends the Subject of the observer design pattern.
    Author:
    Ekkart Kindler, ekki@dtu.dk

    • Method Detail

      • getSpaces

        public List<Space> getSpaces()
        Returns a list of all the games spaces.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of the games spaces

      • setSpaces

        public void setSpaces(List<Space> spaces)
        Sets all the spaces of the game. Note that the provided list of spaces is copied, so that they cannot be changed without the game being aware of the change.
        Parameters:
        spaces - the list of spaces

      • addSpace

        public void addSpace(Space space)
        Adds a space to the game at the end.
        Parameters:
        space - the added space

      • getCardDeck

        public List<Card> getCardDeck()
        Returns a list of the cards in the current deck.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of all the cards currently in the deck

      • drawCardFromDeck

        public Card drawCardFromDeck()
        Removes the topmost card from the deck and returns it.
        Returns:
        the topmost card of the deck

      • removeSpecificCard

        public void removeSpecificCard(Card card)
        Removes the specific card.
        Parameters:
        card - the card

      • returnCardToDeck

        public void returnCardToDeck(Card card)
        Add the given card to the bottom of the deck.
        Parameters:
        card - the card added to the bottom of the deck.

      • setCardDeck

        public void setCardDeck(List<Card> cardDeck)
        Uses the provided list of cards as the new deck. The list will be copied in order to avoid, changes on it without the game being aware of it.
        Parameters:
        cardDeck - the new deck of cards

      • shuffleCardDeck

        public void shuffleCardDeck()
        Shuffles the cards in the deck.

      • getPlayers

        public List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns all the players of the game as an unmodifiable list.
        Returns:
        a list of the current players

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(List<Player> players)
        Sets the list of players. The list of players is actually copied in order to avoid the list being modified without the game being aware of it.
        Parameters:
        players - the list of players

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player player)
        Adds a player to the game.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to be added.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns the current player of the game. This is the player who's turn it is to do the next move (or currently is doing a move).
        Returns:
        the current player

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(Player player)
        Sets the current player. It is required that the player is a player of the game already; otherwise an IllegalArumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        player - the new current player

      • getMoneyForPassingGo

        public int getMoneyForPassingGo()
        Returns:
        the passGo
